gurmukhi: dY muK Fwr lIey krvwr hkwr pcwr pHwr lgwey ]
transliteration: Dai Mouch Dhaar Looe Karvaar Hakaar Pachaar Prahaar Lagade||
translation: Covering the face with shield and holding the sword in hand, they attacked with loud shouts.

gurmukhi: sRaun mY dyq surMg Bey kiv ny mn Bwau iehY Cib pwey ]
transliteration: Sraoun Maid Et Suran Bhae Kav(i) Ne Man Bhaao Ihai Chhab(i) Paae||
translation: The demons are dyed with blood and it seems to the poet;

gurmukhi: rwm mno rn jIq kY Bwlk dY isrpwau sBY phrwey ]16]
transliteration: Raam Mano Ran Jeet Kai Dhaalak Dai Sirpaao Sabhai Pahraae||16||
translation: As if Rama after conquering the war is bestowing (the redcoloured) robes of honour to all bears.16.

gurmukhi: Gwiel GUmq hY rn mY iek lotq hY DrnI ibllwqy ]
transliteration: Ghaail Ghoomat Hai Ran Mai Ik Lotat Hai Dharnoo Bill-laate||
translation: Many wounded warriors are rolling in the battlefield and many of them are writhing and crying on the ground.

gurmukhi: daurq bIc kbMD iPrY ijh dyKq kwier hYN frpwqy ]
transliteration: Daurat Boodhe Kabandh Phirai Jih Dekhat Kaair Hain Darpaate||
translation: The trunks are also twirling there, seeing which the cowards are frightened.

gurmukhi: ieXo mihKwsur ju`Du kIXo qb jMbuk igrJ Bey rMg rwqy ]
transliteration: Iyo Mahikhaasur Juddh(u) Kooyo Tab Janbouk Girajh Bhae Ran Raate||
translation: Mahishasura waged such a war that the jackals and vultures are highly pleased.

gurmukhi: sROn pÍwh mY pwie pswr ky soey hYN sUr mno md mwqy ]17]
transliteration: Sraoun Pravaah Mai Paae Pasaar Ke Soe Hain Soor Mano Mad Maate||17||
translation: And the heroes, being intoxicated, are lying prostrate in the stream of blood.17.

gurmukhi: ju`D kIE mhKwsur dwnv dyKq Bwn clY nhIN pMQw ]
transliteration: Juddh Ko( i)  Mahkhaasur Daanav Dekhat Bhaan Chalai Nahoon Panthaa||
translation: Seeing the fighting in the war of the demon Mahishasura, the sun is not moving on its orbit.

gurmukhi: sROn smUh cilE liK kY cqurwnn BUil gey sB gRMQw ]
transliteration: Sraoun Samoond Chadio Lakh(i) Kai Chaturaanan Bhool(i) Gad Sabh Granthaa||
translation: Brahma has also forgotten his texts on beholding the stream of blood.

gurmukhi: mws inhwr kY giRJ rVYN ctswr pVYN ijmu bwrk sMQw ]
transliteration: Maas Nihaar Kai Grijh Radain Chatsaar Padain Jim(u) Baarak Santhaa||
translation: Seeing the flesh, the vultures are seated in such a way, as if the children are learning their lessons in school.

gurmukhi: swrsuqI qt lY Bt loQ siRMgwl ik is`D bnwvq kMQw ]18]
transliteration: Saarsoutoo Tat Lai Bhat Loth Sringadl Ki Siddh Banaavat Kanthaa||18||
translation: The jackals are pulling the corpses in the field in such a way as if the Yogis, sitting on the banks of Sarswati are mending their patched quilts.18.
